org.company

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.company.App

  • public class App
extends java.lang.Object
    The class containing the app entry point. Note: logs through logback (see logback.xlm in classpath) Errors codes: - 1: Wrong usage - 2: Exception while IO operations - 3: Given arguments are not valid - 4: General Exception (in inner methods) - 5: Exception while waiting for shell process to finish

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method takes as input two jars containing, respectively, the code to protect and the test cases. Then, following the defined methodology, it executes the tests on the code to protect to collect first coverage metrics. Then, it decides which methods to annotate, annotates the methods, applies java2c on the annotated methods and creates the new protected jar. Then, it executes functional tests on both jars (unprotected and protected) to collect execution time (and possibly other metrics). Finally, it wraps functional tests around debugger tests and executes both jars to assert AD protections work
        Parameters:
        args - args are - jarToProtect Path to the .jar file containing the Java code on which the experimentation will run - [jarTestCases] Path to the .jar file containing the Java tests to run on the given jar to protect If not given, tests will be assumed to be in the jarToProtect - [JUnitConsole] Path to the .jar file containing the standalone console of JUnit5 If not given, the internal .jar, inside the lib folder, will be used - [JaCoCoAgent] Path to the .jar file containing the JaCoCo agent for having methods coverage If not given, the internal .jar, inside the lib folder, will be used - [JaCoCoCLI] Path to the .jar file containing the JaCoCo cli for converting methods coverage If not given, the internal .jar, inside the lib folder, will be used - [OutputFolder] Path to the directory where the tool will write all the output files If not given, the current working directory will be used

      • acquireJarPathOption

        private static java.lang.String acquireJarPathOption(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine cmd,
                                                     java.lang.String jarOptionToAcquire,
                                                     java.lang.String defaultValue)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This methods is invoked when parsing program parameters. It acquires the given path and checks that it is not null, it exists, it is not a directory and it is indeed a jar file
        Parameters:
        cmd - the command line object containing the program arguments
        jarOptionToAcquire - the key of the option to acquire
        defaultValue - the default value in case the option was not given. It both default value and the given option are null, throw IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        the option
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the option is null/does not exist/is a directory/it is not a jar file
